intro: Ophrys kamtschatica, commonly known as the Kamchatka bee orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East and parts of eastern Siberia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure that mimics the appearance of a female bee, a feature known as sexual deception. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its flowers are usually yellow or brownish in color, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by male bees. Ophrys kamtschatica is a perennial herb that produces a single spike of flowers, often blooming in late spring to early summer.
